title: ECB chief Draghi bows out with 'never give up' call as Europe's economy shows more signs of strain
text:
Mario Draghi brought the curtain down on his eight-year reign as European Central Bank president on Thursday by shrugging off attacks on its rescue package for the struggling Eurozone.

The Italian said rate-setters should “never give up” on attempts to raise inflation, in his final press conference before handing over to former International Monetary Fund managing director Christine Lagarde.

But the challenge ahead for his successor was underlined by yet more weak survey data revealing stagnant growth among the currency bloc’s private sector companies.
